name: displaced
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having been forced to leave your home, for example by a war or dangerous event: They distribute food and other aid to displaced civilians. Nearly four months after the hurricane, more than 10,000 families remain displaced.
US having been forced to leave your job: The Employment Development Department helps displaced workers find jobs. The transportation company will cease operating and the displaced drivers will have to work for other companies for a lower hourly rate.
having been forced out of its usual or original position: The displaced water spilled down the hill and flooded the highway. A car crash left him with two displaced vertebrae in his neck. See
displace

We aim to raise awareness about the millions of refugee and displaced children around the world.What do they do with the thousands of tons of displaced rock and earth from the tunnel?Tissue in the joint may become displaced, pinched or trapped, causing pain.Huge displaced chunks of river ice destroyed the village.He was limping because of a displaced tendon.
